rubrics.requirements: Core Multi-Process Architecture: A desktop runtime combining Chromium frontend with Node.js backend in isolated processes

sub_tasks.requirements: Main Process: Central control unit with full Node.js and OS access managing application lifecycle and coordinating all child processes
Application Lifecycle Management: Controls application state from launch to quit via the 'app' module
System event handling for 'ready', 'activate', 'window-all-closed', and OS signals to manage application state
Application control methods for programmatic quit, relaunch, focus, and single-instance enforcement
Global configuration management including paths, name, command-line switches, and exit codes
Window Factory and Management: Creates and orchestrates native OS windows that spawn dedicated renderer processes
BrowserWindow/BaseWindow instantiation with each window tied to a dedicated renderer process via Chromium IPC
Window property management including size, position, frame type, parent-child relationships, and platform-specific behaviors
Window lifecycle event handling for 'close', 'focus', 'blur', minimize, maximize, and state changes
Native API Gateway: Exposes OS primitives through Node.js bindings for desktop integration
Native UI component management for menus, tray icons, dialogs, notifications, and platform-specific elements
System service integration including shell operations, clipboard, power monitoring, and global shortcuts
Hardware and device access mediation for screen capture, USB, HID, serial, and bluetooth devices
Security Policy Enforcement: Applies security configurations, fuses, and Chromium switches to control process capabilities
Fuse-based security hardening with compile-time flags to permanently disable features like 'runAsNode'
Chromium security switch configuration and nodeIntegration/contextIsolation policy defaults
Permission and privilege management for sensitive operations like media access, geolocation, and device permissions
Renderer Process: Sandboxed Chromium environment for web content rendering with controlled Node.js integration
WebContents Controller: Core component managing web page rendering and interaction within windows
Navigation and page lifecycle management including reloads, history, and state transitions
Event emission for page lifecycle events like 'did-finish-load', 'dom-ready', 'render-process-gone'
Page interaction methods for JavaScript execution, CSS insertion, printing, zoom, find-in-page, and media capture
DevTools integration and debugging protocol access for development workflows
Context Isolation and Security: Multi-world JavaScript environment separation for secure API exposure
World separation between main world and isolated worlds to prevent prototype pollution and unauthorized access
Preload script execution in isolated world with controlled API exposure through contextBridge
Process sandboxing mechanisms restricting renderer access to system resources by default
Node.js integration control with configurable levels of access and isolation
Web Platform Feature Management: Controls access to web APIs and platform-specific features
Permission gate management for geolocation, camera, microphone, USB, HID, serial, bluetooth via session handlers
Content Security Policy (CSP) enforcement to mitigate XSS and injection attacks
Custom protocol handling and URL scheme registration with security enforcement
Offscreen rendering capabilities with GPU or software frame capture for headless operations
Embedded Content Views: Mechanisms for embedding additional web content with process isolation
WebContentsView implementation for modern, flexible content embedding and layering
Legacy webview tag support for out-of-process iframes maintaining backward compatibility
Utility Process: Lightweight Node.js child processes for CPU-heavy or untrusted tasks with crash isolation
Process spawning and communication via parentPort postMessage for offloading blocking operations
Crash isolation ensuring utility process failures don't affect main or renderer processes
V8 snapshot loading capabilities for reduced startup time with fuse-controlled access
Inter-Process Communication (IPC): Secure messaging infrastructure enabling communication between all process types
Primary Communication Patterns: Core messaging mechanisms for process coordination
Promise-based invoke/handle pattern as the recommended method for bidirectional request-response messaging
Event-based send/on pattern for asynchronous one-way fire-and-forget messaging
Structured clone serialization for complex data transfer between processes
Advanced Communication Mechanisms: High-performance and specialized messaging options
MessageChannelMain/MessagePortMain for direct port-based communication bypassing main IPC router
Transferable objects and shared texture handles for efficient data passing
Synchronous sendSync method (discouraged) for blocking communication with performance impact

rubrics.requirements: Session and Network Management: Per-partition network stack managing browsing contexts, protocols, and request interception

sub_tasks.requirements: Session Partitioning: Isolated browsing contexts with separate data stores and configurations
Storage partition separation for cookies, localStorage, indexedDB, service workers, and extensions per session
Session-specific network stack configuration including proxy settings and certificate handling
Protocol and Request Management: Custom protocol handling and network request interception
Custom protocol registry mapping schemes to handlers (file/buffer/stream/http) with privilege enforcement
WebRequest API for intercepting and modifying network requests and responses
Network logging, proxy resolution (PAC, manual), and NTLM SSO support
Certificate verification and SSL/TLS configuration management
HTTP Client Integration: Node.js-based network requests from main process
Net module providing HTTP/HTTPS request capabilities from main process

rubrics.requirements: Native Platform Integration: Comprehensive suite for creating native desktop experiences across operating systems

sub_tasks.requirements: Native UI Components: Standard OS interface elements and user interaction systems
Menu System: Cross-platform menu creation and management
Application and context menu management via Menu and MenuItem modules
Keyboard shortcut and accelerator binding for menu items and global actions
Platform-specific menu behaviors and styling adaptations
System Integration Components: OS-level UI elements and notifications
System tray icon creation and management via Tray module
Native system dialogs for file operations, alerts, and error messages via dialog module
OS-level notifications using the Notification API
Platform-specific UI features like macOS Dock, Touch Bar, Windows Taskbar integration
System Services: OS-level service integration and hardware access
File System and Shell Integration: OS interaction for file and application management
Shell operations for opening files/URLs and trash management via shell module
File system access, dialog management, and drag-drop functionality
Clipboard operations for text, images, and rich content via clipboard module
System Monitoring and Control: Hardware state and user preference tracking
Power state monitoring for battery, suspend, resume events via powerMonitor
Display and screen information querying including metrics and cursor position via screen module
System theme and color preference access through systemPreferences and nativeTheme
Global keyboard shortcuts registration for app-wide hotkeys via globalShortcut
Hardware Device Access: Mediated access to system hardware and peripherals
Screen and window capture for sharing/recording via desktopCapturer module
Device permission management for WebUSB, WebHID, WebSerial, and Bluetooth APIs
Hardware device enumeration and access control with user consent workflows

rubrics.requirements: Packaging and Distribution System: Complete application lifecycle management from build to deployment

sub_tasks.requirements: Build and Packaging Pipeline: Multi-platform application bundling and optimization
ASAR Virtual File System: Single-file application bundling with performance optimization
Application source bundling into tar-like ASAR format for improved read performance
Integrity validation with header hash verification and runtime fuse checking
Unpacked file support for native addons and large assets to avoid extraction penalties
Cross-Platform Compilation: Multi-architecture and multi-OS build support
Cross-compilation capabilities for ARM64, Win-ARM, and other target architectures
GN/Ninja build system wrapper around Chromium with distributed compilation support
Native dependency bundling and resolution for platform-specific libraries
Code Signing and Security: Application integrity and platform compliance
Platform Security Compliance: OS-specific signing and validation requirements
Code signing integration for macOS notarization and Windows Authenticode
App store submission workflows and validation processes
Certificate management and code signature verification
Auto-Update System: Automated application update delivery and management
Update Coordination: Client-server update protocol and management
AutoUpdater module leveraging Squirrel.Mac/Windows for update checking, downloading, and installation
Update server communication with metadata handling in platform-specific formats
Delta update application and incremental patching capabilities
Update Security and Verification: Ensuring update integrity and rollback capabilities
Update verification and code signature validation before installation
Rollback capabilities and update failure recovery mechanisms

rubrics.requirements: Native Module and Extension System: Support for external code integration and browser extensions

sub_tasks.requirements: Native Module Integration: C++ addon support and compilation management
Native Node.js addon rebuilding against Electron's specific V8/ABI using node-gyp or prebuild
Context-aware module loading with support for multiple Electron versions
Non-context-aware module blocking for enhanced security
Chrome Extension Support: Browser extension loading and API compatibility
Extension host process mirroring Chromium's extension system with content scripts and API support
Chrome DevTools extension loading with subset API compatibility
Extension background page execution in renderer processes

rubrics.requirements: Development and Debugging Infrastructure: Comprehensive tooling for application development, testing, and diagnostics

sub_tasks.requirements: Developer Tooling: Debugging and development workflow support
DevTools Integration: Chrome DevTools protocol access for debugging
Chrome DevTools protocol integration for debugging both main and renderer processes
DevTools front-end serving from bundled Chromium revision with remote debugging target support
Extension-based debugging tools and inspector capabilities
Performance and Monitoring Tools: Application performance analysis and optimization
Content tracing module for performance trace capture and analysis
Memory profiling and leak detection capabilities
CPU profiling and performance bottleneck identification
Testing and Automation: Automated testing framework and CI/CD integration
Test Automation Support: WebDriver and headless testing capabilities
WebDriver integration for automated UI testing and browser automation
Headless operation mode for CI/CD pipeline integration
Unit testing framework support with mocking capabilities for Electron APIs
Crash Reporting and Diagnostics: Error tracking and application health monitoring
Crash Collection and Reporting: Automated crash dump collection and analysis
Crashpad/CrashpadClient integration across all platforms for minidump collection
CrashReporter module for automatic crash dump submission to configured servers
Stack-walking symbol resolution and crash analysis capabilities
Sentry-compatible endpoint integration for crash data aggregation
